009package imagingbook.common.color.sets;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012import java.util.Objects;
013
014/**
015 * Interface used for color enum types.
016 * @author WB
017 *
018 */
019public interface ColorEnumeration {
020        
021        /**
022         * Returns the enum item's {@link Color}.
023         * Example:
024         * <pre>
025         * Color c = BasicAwtColor.Blue.getColor();</pre>
026         * @return the item's AWT {@link Color}
027         */
028        public Color getColor();
029
030        /**
031         * Returns an array of colors defined by the specified
032         * {@link ColorEnumeration} enum class.
033         * <pre>
034         * Color[] colors = ColorEnumeration.getColors(BasicAwtColor.class);</pre>
035         * @param clazz a {@link ColorEnumeration} enum class
036         * @return a {@link Color} array
037         */
038        public static Color[] getColors(Class<? extends ColorEnumeration> clazz) {
039                if (!clazz.isEnum()) {
040                        throw new RuntimeException(ColorEnumeration.class.getSimpleName() + 
041                                        " may only be implemented by enum types!");
042                }
043                ColorEnumeration[] colorItems = clazz.getEnumConstants(); 
044                Objects.requireNonNull(colorItems);
045                return getColors(colorItems);
046        }
047        
048        /**
049         * Returns an array of colors for the specified 
050         * {@link ColorEnumeration} items. Example:
051         * <pre>
052         * Color[] colors = ColorEnumeration.getColors(BasicAwtColor.Blue, BasicAwtColor.Green);</pre>
053         * @param cols a sequence of {@link ColorEnumeration} items
054         * @return a {@link Color} array
055         */
056        public static Color[] getColors(ColorEnumeration... cols) {
057                Color[] colors = new Color[cols.length];
058                for (int i = 0; i < cols.length; i++) {
059                        colors[i] = cols[i].getColor();
060                }
061                return colors;
062        }
063        
064        
065        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
066        
067//      public static void main(String[] args) {
068//              Color col = BasicAwtColor.Blue.getColor();
069//              System.out.println(col.toString());
070//                              
071//              Color[] colors1 = ColorEnumeration.getColors(BasicAwtColor.class);
072//              
073//              for (Color c : colors1) {
074//                      System.out.println(c.toString());
075//              }
076//              
077//              Color[] colors2 = ColorEnumeration.getColors(BasicAwtColor.Blue, BasicAwtColor.Green);
078//              
079//              for (Color c : colors2) {
080//                      System.out.println(c.toString());
081//              }
082//      }
083        
084}
